item.description:
Posted on Behalf of The Boston Vegetarian Society

 

Our annual Peace Abbey event on June 12 is this Sunday!  So it's time to give some practical details below.  You'll find the original announcement on our website calendar at   http://www.BostonVeg.org.

1)  RSVP
2)  Volunteering
3)  Donation for the Peace Abbey
4)  Logistics - Seating, rest rooms, speaker site
5)  Car pooling
6)  Directions to Peace Abbey
7)  Free parking locations
8)  Overnight accommodations on site

This Sunday will be a chance to be together and explore the unique and wonderful setting of the Peace Abbey, visit the animals, enjoy a great vegan potluck meal, and hear scholar/professor/author Paul Waldau's presentation!

** And remember! **  Like No Udder, the vegan ice cream truck, will be with us selling their smooth and creamy softie ice cream cones and milk shakes.

Rain or shine, it will be a beautiful day.  Please bring friends, family, and non-vegetarians -- there is plenty of room and we welcome non-vegetarians to experience a fabulous vegan meal and hear this speaker!  But never hesitate to come alone; many do, and we're a friendly group.

We will be trying a new strategy to facilitate traffic flow around the potluck tables!


1)  RSVP

It helps us to plan, so please reply to http://www.BostonVeg and give the names of people attending.
.org

**Please reply in this format**:
Your Name
Your E-mail Address
Your Phone Number
Can you give a ride? / Do you need a ride?
Your Town (or where you can meet

2)  VOLUNTEERS - we need you!!

* Please be part of the team  that helps to make things happen!  Jobs include:    potluck helpers (greatest need here), clean up team, speaker room assistants, etc.  Please pitch in!   Offers like "I'll do anything" are greatly appreciated.    (Hit Reply)

* Do you play piano or other instrument?  We'd like to offer music as people arrive for the speaker presentation in the church.


3)  DONATION FOR THE PEACE ABBEY

We want to collect a very big donation to give to the Peace Abbey, not just to cover the cost of our being there, but to help them continue their steadfast and imaginative work for peace, nonviolence, and
compassionate living.  The Peace Abbey has made a tremendous contribution to promoting vegetarianism.  It is public knowledge that the Peace Abbey needs to raise funds to continue their great work. A swell of community support keeps the Peace Abbey in action.  Please come with generous hearts, open checkbooks, and ready cash.  We'll pass a free-will donation box.



4)  LOGISTICS - to make your visit easy

* We try to be eco-friendly, so please bring your own reusable bottle full of water.  There will be Kangen filtered water available on tap, too.  We will supply disposables for the potluck, but feel free to BYO table setting if you wish.

* Potluck: Walk up the wooden ramp into the main building to the kitchen.  There will be some seating for eating on the main level, plus go down the stairs (via the kitchen) to the large basement room, where there will be lots of tables and chairs.  Outdoor seating, too.   (We need potluck volunteers!)

* Rest rooms are on the lower/basement level (where the tables are set up.)  When we move to the church for the speaker program at 3 PM, there are rest rooms behind the speaker room.    Contact me re wheelchair access.

* At 2:50 please start your stroll to the white church for our speaker program at 3 PM!

*  Our speaker Paul Waldau's book will be for sale at a discount after his presentation.  Please pick one up for just $15, cash or check only.



5)  CAR POOLING - DRIVERS needed - all replies by Wednesday, June 8, at 3 PM.  Pls follow instructions below.

Drivers are always needed. Riders, please offer to chip in for gas. Friendships have been made by carpooling to our events!  Here's how it works:

If you CAN GIVE or need a ride, please reply by Wednesday, June 8, at 3 PM.  Send a separate email from your RSVP and put CARPOOLING PEACE ABBEY as the subject line ( Gmail stacks emails with the same subject line, so they'll all stay together).

*Use the below format*, so I can quickly cut and paste info into a group e-mail.  On Wed. PM, I'll compile the responses and send them to the group.  Then respondents can get in touch with each other to work out their own arrangements.


6)  DIRECTIONS

The Peace Abbey
2 North Main Street
Where Route 27 and Route 16 overlap
Sherborn, MA  (next to Natick, 35-40 min. west of Boston)
http://maps.google.com/

>>From Boston:
Take Route 9 West and exit at Route 16 in Wellesley.  Turn left at end of ramp onto Rt. 16 West.
Follow directions below.
~ OR ~
Take Mass Pike West to Exit 16 (Wellesley) Take Route 16 West, winding scenically through Wellesley, Natick, and into Sherborn.   Watch signs carefully; Rt. 16 takes some sharp left turns.


*You are almost at the Peace Abbey* when you see the Sherborn Inn on your right, then the Sherborn Fire House (white) on your left.  When you ride over a small railroad track, and go up a small hill, the Peace Abbey is just ahead on your left, just after an area of trees.   There are signs and a large statue of Gandhi out front.

>>From the West:
Take Route 9 East, then take Route 27 South through Natick and into Sherborn.  Rt. 27 will overlap with Rt. 16 in Sherborn, so see directions above for landmarks on Rt. 16/27.



7)  FREE PARKING

There is plenty of free parking in three convenient parking areas:

a)  The small paved lot at the Abbey will be for special needs/handicap, speaker, and BVS staff ONLY.

b)  Street parking:  Approaching from the north (that is, if you are on Rt. 16W or Rt. 27S, which overlap), pass the Peace Abbey driveway on your left and take the next left.     Park along this road "Village Way" ON
ONE SIDE OF THE ROAD ONLY.  Two sided parking is *not allowed*.  This road leads to a housing complex.    Park ONLY along the entrance road.   DO NOT PARK in the visitor or resident spaces for the housing park!  NOTE: They will TOW cars parked where I've said not to park.

c)  Church lot:  We can park in the Unitarian Universalist Church lot just a 2-3 minute walk from the Peace Abbey.  This is where the speaker presentation will be.  If you like, you can drop off your potluck dish at the Peace Abbey gate, then go park.  We'll put your dish on the stone fence till you return.  Approaching from the north, pass the Peace Abbey on your left, and you will face a fork in the road.  Go to *right* of
fork (Rt. 16).    Continue 500 ft. and you'll see the U.U. Church (white wooden historic church) on your left.   Park in the lots on both sides of the church.

d)  Church lot #2:  If somehow you don't park at the above, the Pilgrim Church lot is nearby on Rt. 27.  So at the fork, bear left onto Rt. 27.  Pilgrim church is just ahead on the left.



8)  OVERNIGHT ACCOMMODATIONS

The Peace Abbey Guest House offers four beautiful guest rooms!
Stay on site at modest rates:
http://www.bostonveg.org/bb.html#MetroWest

See you Sunday, June 12 at 1 PM!

Info:  BVS  617-424-8846

Evelyn Kimber
Boston Vegetarian Society
http://www.BostonVeg.org




--
Boston Vegetarian Society, P. O. Box 38-1071, Cambridge, MA 02238-1071
